description: The application is to rezone the lands from C-1 to CD-1 to permit a mixed-use development with 25-storey and 17-storey buildings, 357 secured-rental units (20% below-market), and commercial uses.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 REZONING: 5755-5791 Oak Street and 1008 West 41st Avenue
To rezone 5755-5791 Oak Street and 1008 West 41st Avenue from C-1 (Commercial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit a mixed-use development with 25-storey and 17-storey buildings connected by a six-storey podium, with 357 secured rental units, of which 20% will be secured at below-market rents. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 7.59 and building heights of 78.7 m (258 ft.) (sub-area A) and 54.6 m (179 ft.) (sub-area B) are proposed. Applicant: Wesgroup Properties. Recommended Approval by the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions.

CD-1 Rezoning: 5755-5791 Oak Street and 1008 West 41st Avenue
The report evaluates an application to rezone 5755-5791 Oak Street and 1008 West 41st Avenue from C-1 to CD-1 to permit a mixed-use development with 25-storey and 17-storey buildings, 357 secured-rental units (20% below-market), and commercial uses. The application exceeds the anticipated height and density, but staff support it based on the changing context, emerging directions in the Vancouver Plan, and the delivery of 357 secured rental housing units including a portion of below-market units. The report recommends referring the rezoning application and plans to Public Hearing with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve the application, subject to conditions. The Director of Legal Services is instructed to prepare the necessary by-laws for consideration at the Public Hearing, including a Housing Agreement By-law and an amendment to the Noise Control By-law.

behalf: West 59th Avenue & Cambie Street Investments Ltd.
description: The application is to rezone the lands at 7525 Cambie Street from C-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 1.20 to 3.22 and the height from 10.7 m to 23.8 m to permit a six-storey mixed-use building with 67 strata-titled residential units and commercial space. The proposed uses and form of development are consistent with the Cambie Corridor Plan.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 7525 Cambie Street
Rezone 7525 Cambie Street from C-1 (Commercial) to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) to permit a six-storey mixed-use building with commercial use at grade and 67 strata-titled units. Proposed FSR of 3.22 and height of 23.8 m (78 ft.). Applicant: Wesgroup Properties. Recommended Approval by General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions.

CD-1 Rezoning: 7525 Cambie Street
The application by Wesgroup Properties, on behalf of West 59th Avenue & Cambie Street Investments Ltd., is to rezone the lands at 7525 Cambie Street from C-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 1.20 to 3.22 and the height from 10.7 m to 23.8 m to permit a six-storey mixed-use building with 67 strata-titled residential units and commercial space. The proposed uses and form of development are consistent with the Cambie Corridor Plan. The application is recommended for approval in principle, subject to a Public Hearing, and conditions.

description: The application is to rezone the lands at 1302-1318 East 12th Avenue from RM-11N (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The proposed changes are to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 1.70 to 3.21 and the maximum building height from 13.7 m (45 ft.) to 24.18 m (79 ft.) to permit a six-storey mixed-use building containing 33 secured market rental residential units with commercial space on the ground floor.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 REZONING: 1302-1318 East 12th Avenue
To rezone 1302-1318 East 12th Avenue from RM-11N (Residential) to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) to permit a six-storey mixed-use building with 33 secured rental units and commercial space. Proposed FSR of 3.21 and height of 24.20 m (79 ft.). Applicant: David Wong Architect. Recommended Approval by General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability, subject to conditions. Approval subject to: Housing Agreement By-law, Sign By-law amendments, Noise Control By-law amendments.

CD-1 Rezoning: 1302-1318 East 12th Avenue
The application by David Wong Architect, on behalf of XGX Apartments Ltd., is to rezone the lands at 1302-1318 East 12th Avenue from RM-11N (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The proposed changes are to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 1.70 to 3.21 and the maximum building height from 13.7 m (45 ft.) to 24.18 m (79 ft.) to permit a six-storey mixed-use building containing 33 secured market rental residential units with commercial space on the ground floor. The proposed form of development is generally approved, with the Director of Planning allowed to make minor alterations. The application is recommended for approval in principle, subject to the Public Hearing and Conditions of Approval.

description: A rezoning application has been received to permit construction of a three-storey non-market rental development. The subject site is located at the northwest corner of Godwin Avenue and Sunset Street, and is designated for community institutional uses. The development proposal is for a three-storey non-market rental development with full underground parking and shared access with the adjacent property. The proposed zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District (based on P5, RM2 and RM2r). The development will provide 18 units, including 4 adaptable units, and a parking ratio of 0.35 vehicle parking spaces per rental unit is proposed. The proposed density is 1.2 FAR and 1,497.3 m2 GFA. A Ground Lease Agreement for this City-owned site will be finalized prior to Building Permit issuance, with the Provincial Rental Housing Corporation as the lessee and BC Housing providing capital and operating funding.

description: A rezoning application has been received to permit the addition of a third storey to an existing two-storey non-market rental development at 5825 Sunset Street, in order to provide six additional non-market rental units. The subject site is currently zoned CD Comprehensive Development District (based on the P5 Community Institutional District and RM2 Multiple Family Residential District). The proposed zoning is an Amended CD Comprehensive Development District (based on P5 Community Institutional District, RM2 and RM2r Multiple Family Residential Districts). The maximum potential density for the site is 1.8 FAR, and the proposed density is 0.99 FAR including the third storey addition. The development will have a total of 15 units, including the 6 new units. A Housing Agreement will be required to protect and regulate affordability measures and tenure of the non-market rental units.

The maximum potential density for the site is 1.8 FAR, and the proposed density is 0.99 FAR including the third storey addition. The development will have a total of 15 units, including the 6 new units. The rezoning is recommended to be forwarded to First and Second Reading at a future Council meeting.

description: The purpose of this rezoning is to permit the use of the site for the full range of uses and development opportunities under the P3 District at 3676 Kensington Avenue to facilitate a revised design for community facilities. The site is the location of the Bill Copeland Sports Centre, which includes the Bill Copeland Ice Arena, Burnaby Lake Ice Rink, and C.G. Brown Memorial Pool (since demolished). The approved CD zoning for the site will need to be rezoned to P3 - Parks and Public Space District to allow for the full range of permitted uses. Specific development plans are not proposed as part of this rezoning, and a revised design for the facility will be submitted as part of the Preliminary Plan Approval (PPA) and Building Permit processes.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #24-02 - 3676 Kensington Avenue
The purpose of this rezoning is to permit the use of the site for the full range of uses and development opportunities under the P3 District at 3676 Kensington Avenue to facilitate a revised design for community facilities. The site is the location of the Bill Copeland Sports Centre, which includes the Bill Copeland Ice Arena, Burnaby Lake Ice Rink, and C.G. Brown Memorial Pool (since demolished). The approved CD zoning for the site will need to be rezoned to P3 - Parks and Public Space District to allow for the full range of permitted uses. Specific development plans are not proposed as part of this rezoning, and a revised design for the facility will be submitted as part of the Preliminary Plan Approval (PPA) and Building Permit processes. This rezoning requires the approval of the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure due to the proximity of the site to the Trans-Canada Highway.

description: The applicant, Southgate City Homes Ltd., is proposing to expand the original rezoning proposal (REZ #23-09) to include a portion of 7208 14th Avenue, located within the adjacent Ernie Winch neighborhood of the Southgate Neighborhood Master Plan area (Site B), in addition to the original site at a portion of 7201 11th Avenue (Site A). The current zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District, and the proposed zoning is an amended CD Comprehensive Development District based on RM5 and RM5r Multiple Family Residential Districts, C2 Community Commercial District, and the Southgate Neighborhood Master Plan and Edmonds Town Centre Plan as guidelines. The expanded site is intended to accommodate the Inclusionary Rental units required under the City's Rental Use Zoning Policy.

rawSummaries.summary:
REZ #23-09 - PORTION OF 7201 11TH AVENUE - EXPANDED SITE PROPOSAL TO INCLUDE PORTION OF 7208 14TH AVENUE (SOUTHGATE CITY)
The applicant, Southgate City Homes Ltd., is proposing to expand the original rezoning proposal (REZ #23-09) to include a portion of 7208 14th Avenue, located within the adjacent Ernie Winch neighborhood of the Southgate Neighborhood Master Plan area (Site B), in addition to the original site at a portion of 7201 11th Avenue (Site A). The current zoning is CD Comprehensive Development District, and the proposed zoning is an amended CD Comprehensive Development District based on RM5 and RM5r Multiple Family Residential Districts, C2 Community Commercial District, and the Southgate Neighborhood Master Plan and Edmonds Town Centre Plan as guidelines. The expanded site is intended to accommodate the Inclusionary Rental units required under the City's Rental Use Zoning Policy. The recommendation is for staff to continue working with the applicant towards a revised plan of development on the expanded site.

description: The application is to rezone the lands at 1805 Victoria Drive from RT-5 (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the FSR from 0.6 to 2.0 and the building height from 10.7 m to 20.9 m, to permit a four-storey building containing a firehall and office space for the Vancouver Fire and Rescue Services.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 1805 Victoria Drive
The application is to rezone the lands at 1805 Victoria Drive from RT-5 (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the FSR from 0.6 to 2.0 and the building height from 10.7 m to 20.9 m, to permit a four-storey building containing a firehall and office space for the Vancouver Fire and Rescue Services. The proposed form of development is generally as prepared by HCMA Architecture and Design received October 13, 2023, subject to the Director of Planning's approval of the detailed scheme. description: The report evaluates an application to rezone 5350-5430 Heather Street from R1-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 0.70 to 6.28 and the building height from 11.5 m to 60 m to permit two 18-storey residential buildings with 344 rental units, of which 20% would be below-market rental units.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 5350-5430 Heather Street
The report evaluates an application to rezone 5350-5430 Heather Street from R1-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 0.70 to 6.28 and the building height from 11.5 m to 60 m to permit two 18-storey residential buildings with 344 rental units, of which 20% would be below-market rental units. The proposed use and form of development are consistent with the Cambie Corridor Plan. The rezoning application and plans are referred to Public Hearing with the recommendation of the General Manager to approve the application, subject to conditions. The Director of Legal Services is instructed to prepare the necessary by-law(s) and Housing Agreement By-law for consideration at the Public Hearing.

description: The report recommends an amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from CD-1(26) (Comprehensive Development) District to RR-3B (Residential Rental) District for 4635 Arbutus Street. The amendment would allow for a six-storey, mixed-use rental building of which 20% of the residential floor area is secured as below-market rental units, in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy (SRP). An estimated total of 74 secured rental units may be delivered through this application. The site area is approximately 1,762 sq. m (18,966 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 41.3 m (135.5 ft.) along Arbutus Street and a depth of 42.7 m (140 ft.). The current uses on the rezoning site, 4635 Arbutus Street, are a two-storey commercial building constructed in 1965 and a surface parking lot.

rawSummaries.summary:
Rezoning: 4635-4675 Arbutus Street
The report recommends an amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from CD-1(26) (Comprehensive Development) District to RR-3B (Residential Rental) District for 4635 Arbutus Street. The amendment would allow for a six-storey, mixed-use rental building of which 20% of the residential floor area is secured as below-market rental units, in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy (SRP). An estimated total of 74 secured rental units may be delivered through this application. The site area is approximately 1,762 sq. m (18,966 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 41.3 m (135.5 ft.) along Arbutus Street and a depth of 42.7 m (140 ft.). The current uses on the rezoning site, 4635 Arbutus Street, are a two-storey commercial building constructed in 1965 and a surface parking lot. The property does not contain residential rental tenancies and the Tenant Relocation and Protection Policy (TRPP) does not apply.

description: The application is to rezone from C-3A to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 3.0 to 8.5 and the height from 30 ft. to 295 ft. with additional height for the portion with rooftop amenity, to permit a mixed-use development with 28-storey (west tower) and 21-storey (east tower) buildings connected with a single-storey podium, with 514 secured rental units, commercial uses and a 37-space turn-key childcare facility.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 130-150 West Broadway and 2520 Columbia Street
The application by Arcadis, on behalf 130 West Broadway Investments Inc., is to rezone from C-3A to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 3.0 to 8.5 and the height from 30 ft. to 295 ft. with additional height for the portion with rooftop amenity, to permit a mixed-use development with 28-storey (west tower) and 21-storey (east tower) buildings connected with a single-storey podium, with 514 secured rental units, commercial uses and a 37-space turn-key childcare facility. The draft CD-1 By-law and the proposed form of development are approved in principle, subject to the Conditions of Approval contained in Appendix B. The Director of Legal Services is instructed to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to enactment of the CD-1 By-law. The application to amend the Sign By-law and the Noise Control By-law to establish regulations for the new CD-1 are also approved.

description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a 7-storey (Z/D 6-storey) Community Care Facility - Class B noncombustible building consists of
1st storey - independent living units,

3rd and 4th storeys - assisted living units,
5th and 6th storeys - independent living units,
7th storey - amenity space and exterior occupied roof deck,
All over on level of underground parking with vehicle access from lane.
Shared amenity spaces will be located on Levels P1 through 4th storey.

This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511) with amendments effective on September 7, 2023.
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements. The building is designed with High Building measures.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.
The building will be equipped with 2-stage Fire Alarm System.

description: Application for Rezoning from 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' Zone to 'Light Industrial, Office and Limited Commercial (ZI21) - Aberdeen Village (City Centre)' Zone and 'School & Institutional Use (SI)' Zone. Key components include: one six-storey non-residential industrial and limited commercial mixed-use strata-titled building; a total floor area of approximately 8,090 m2 (87,077 ft2); design and construction to meet Step 2 of the BC Energy Step Code; voluntary developer contributions towards public art and community amenities; and provision of a 10 m wide linear City Park along Hazelbridge Way. The site is designated 'Mixed Employment' in the Official Community Plan (OCP) and 'Industrial Reserve – Limited Commercial' in the City Centre Area Plan (CCAP), intended for non-residential urban business park light industrial mixed-use development.

description: The current application is to rezone 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way from Industrial Business Park (IB1) to High-Density Mixed Use (ZMU52) - Oval Village (City Centre) to permit a high density mixed-use project.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 17-782750
Request to Extend the Rezoning Adoption Deadline for the Application by Landa Oval Development Ltd at 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way.

The current application is to rezone 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way from Industrial Business Park (IB1) to High-Density Mixed Use (ZMU52) - Oval Village (City Centre) to permit a high density mixed-use project. The rezoning for 6851 and 6871 Elmbridge Way was granted 1st reading on November 14, 2022 and 3rd reading on May 15, 2023. The applicant has requested an extension of the rezoning adoption deadline from April 15, 2024 to June 10, 2024 to comply with the in-stream protection related to the market rental housing policy change that ends on June 20, 2024.

description: The application is to permit the construction of 36 townhouse units and three secondary suites. The site is being rezoned from 'Single Detached (RS 1/E)' to 'Parking Structure Townhouses (RTP4)'. The development will include 30 multi-level townhouse units and six ground-level flats, with unit sizes ranging from 66.60 m2 (718 ft2) to 177.53 m2 (1,911 ft2), providing a mix of two to four-bedroom units. Three of the 30 multi-level townhouse units are proposed to contain a secondary suite (studio) fronting Spires Road. Parking will be provided within the parking structure at grade. Frontage improvements, road widening, new sidewalk and landscaping, new fire hydrants, public walkways, and upgrades to the storm and sanitary sewers will be constructed through a separate Servicing Agreement prior to final adoption of the rezoning bylaw.

description: The applicant is proposing a revised development that includes 151 market rental units, with 68 units (45%) as family-friendly units. The revised proposal also includes 10 three-bedroom units. The rezoning application provides an opportunity to secure up to 577.7 m2 (6,218.31 ft2) of City-owned amenity space, to be constructed in a subsequent phase as part of a larger City-owned facility on the site. The legal agreements ensure the City may secure up to 4,975 m2 (53,550 ft2) of amenity space at Council's discretion. A physical childcare facility is not required in the current development phase, but the applicant is committed to exploring the inclusion of home business-based childcare programs in up to three ground-oriented LEMR units on Parcel 8.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 23-011557
Application by Lansdowne Phase 1 Limited Partnership for Rezoning at 5300 No. 3 Road:
- Originally proposed 151 market rental units, with 68 units (45%) as family-friendly units
- Revised proposal to include 10 three-bedroom units
- Rezoning application provides opportunity to secure up to 577.7 m2 (6,218.31 ft2) of City-owned amenity space, to be constructed in a subsequent phase as part of a larger City-owned facility on the site
- Legal agreements ensure the City may secure up to 4,975 m2 (53,550 ft2) of amenity space at Council's discretion
- A physical childcare facility is not required in the current development phase, but the applicant is committed to exploring the inclusion of home business-based childcare programs in up to three ground-oriented LEMR units on Parcel 8

The purpose is to allow the existing seasonal farm labour accommodation on-site and to permit more than one seasonal farm labour accommodation located on a lot without an existing single detached housing.

description: Application for an Agricultural Land Reserve Non-Adhering Residential Use and Rezoning at 18431 Westminster Highway from 'Agriculture (AG1)' to 'Agriculture (AG3)' to allow seasonal farm labour accommodation. The subject property is currently occupied by two single-family dwellings, an active farm operation, and associated farm buildings and seasonal farm labour accommodation.

rawSummaries.summary:
RZ 22-009024
Application by Jason Levelton for an Agricultural Land Reserve Non-Adhering Residential Use and Rezoning at 18431 Westminster Highway from "Agriculture (AG1)" to "Agriculture (AG3)". Staff recommendation: 1) Forward the application for an Agricultural Land Reserve Non-Adhering Residential Use to allow seasonal farm labour accommodation to the Agricultural Land Commission, and 2) Introduce and give first reading to Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10534, for the rezoning of 18431 Westminster Highway from "Agriculture (AG1)" to "Agriculture (AG3)" to allow the existing seasonal farm labour accommodation on-site. The subject property is currently occupied by two single-family dwellings, an active farm operation, and associated farm buildings and seasonal farm labour accommodation.
